title: Display Problems while scrolling in Firefox
content: Hello, I am using the latest version of Firefox (77). In this version, but also all the previous versions, I have a problem while scrolling long web pages. Once I have scrolled down quite a bit to far below the immediately visible area, there will be a horizontal area across the entire browser window that does not show anything or is blacked out. It appears as if that area is covering up the info below it (as in a lower layer).  If I continue to scroll further down, these blacked out areas appear regularly. This forces me to switch to another browser (Chrome, Edge) where the problem does not occur, just so that I can read that info or access the buttons etc. hidden in FF.  I am working with a Lenovo Laptop attached to a docking station and two extra 27 inch screens that are turned to vertical and stand side by side.  The attached Screenshot gives you an idea. It was taken from this page: https://www.afrikarma.de/safari-lodges-und-camps-in-afrika/ with the parameter for number of items to display in the table ...

title: HTTP3/QUIC Support - Super-slow on Google sites
content: I realize HTTP3/QUIC is not officially supported, but Chromium-based browsers have no problems with using it, even with ad-blocking extensions. Mozilla Firefox becomes very slow for Google-based services (Google Search, Gmail, YouTube) and unresponsive when HTTP3 is enabled in about:config. Since QUIC is mostly a Google invention and Google services are the ones that utilize it the most, I wonder if Google deliberately slows down Firefox-based QUIC. The negative effect of HTTP3 in Firefox browsers with Google services is something that I test and experience on multiple networks, devices, device types, and versions of Firefox. I use Wireshark to see if QUIC is the protocol that causes slow downs and it is, but only for Google-based services. There are other non-Google QUIC services and they are actually faster/quicker with Firefox HTTP3 flag enabled. That again makes me wonder if Google deliberately creates an HTTP3/QUIC problem for Firefox...

title: Surface Pro 6 on screen keyboard not working
content: When in tablet mode (keyboard folded back or unattached), I can not use the on screen keyboard. When I tap a field (address bar, search bar, or any field on any website that I've tested), the keyboard comes up, then immediately closes again. If I use the on screen keyboard button from the taskbar, the same thing happens: keyboard slides up, window jumps a bit, then keyboard closes again. I have already tried adjusting all the settings under about:config with the search "osk" as suggested in other threads I've seen. Have also tried disabling all addons, no change. Tried on current FF standard version and firefox nightly (newest update on 6/9/2020, whatever the version is). Both have the exact same issue even  after adjusting the settings under about:config. I'm not sure how long this has been going on since I never really use tablet mode (primarily use this laptop for coding and classes where I need to type, apparently haven't done any web browsing in tablet mode.) Any help is appreciated.

title: Unable to upload files using Firefox Ubuntu 18.04
content: Hello there, I'm writing to report a problem that I had with Firefox. I'm using Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS, GNOME 3.28.2 with a 64-bit OS.  Recently, I noticed that I could not save PDFs from the internet to my hard drive when I was using Firefox. Normally, if I had opened a PDF in Firefox, I could press 'Ctrl + S' on my keyboard and a save dialog window would appear. Now however, the save dialog window would not appear. No error messages appeared, so I have no screenshots to show. The only thing I could do to save the PDF was to click on the 'Download' icon in Firefox's PDF reader. Right-clicking on links to PDFs and selecting 'Save As' would yield the same result: no save dialog window, nothing. I thought that the problem might be because my version of Firefox was not up to date, so I ran 'sudo apt-get update' and 'sudo apt-get install firefox' in the terminal. I also updated the flash plugin.  Afterwards, I noticed that I could not upload files from my hard drive as an attachment for e-mails. I tried this on diffe...

title: Html5 videoplayback is choppy on Fedora Linux when using Folding on GPU
content: When I am running folding at home on my desktop in fedora linux, html5 video playback is very choppy when played locally and when streamed.  If I play the same video in vlc or google chrome while folding on my gpu, I do not have choppy playback. When I disable GPU folding, video playback is smooth.  Disabling hardware acceleration and webgl did not solve the problem. I don't understand what's causing the issue. If video playback does not use hardware acceleration (GPU), it should be smooth, but this doesn't occur.  I think it might be a issue with how firefox handles html5 video playback since I don't have the same issues in vlc or google chrome.  Thing's I have tried, but have resulted in smooth video playback   uninstalling firefox, deleting my mozilla directory  updating firefox  reinstalling firefox  updating fedora linux  updating nvidia proprietary graphics drivers  playing a video with all plugins disabled

title: Apparmor May Block Firefox Access to Internet on Ubuntu
content: Good Evening, My Firefox browser on Ubuntu OS was working fine until today. The only changes I’ve made are setting up UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall) and enabling the Apparmor (provides access control for apps) profile for Firefox. Now I get the “Server Not Found” error every time I try to use Firefox.  I have tested multiple websites and they all return this error. I have also checked my firewall log and it doesn’t show any blocked connections when this is happening. This leads me to believe that Apparmor may be blocking any/all of Firefox’s attempts to request a connection to the internet. I have opened the Apparmor profile for Firefox in my text editor but don’t know which features are likely to be causing the problem. Any advice would be amazing! I appreciate you volunteering your time to help the noobies out here! Please let me know if you have any questions. Best, OceanPeaks

title: Firefox / "consent.exe" crashing in infinite loop on startup
content: I have had the following issue 5 times now over a longer period of time (Windows 10, Firefox 77.0.1 and earlier versions). Rarely, when I want to start Firefox, I get stuck in an infinite loop. The mouse cursor changes to a "loading" cursor and starts flickering forever, trying to start Firefox. This is bad enough for my whole system to behave strangely, e.g. mouse clicks will randomly not register or release. Upon inspecting the task manager, I find that `consent.exe` repeatedly pops up and disappears. I assume it crashes and then firefox tries to restart, repeating in an infinite loop ... I only recently found a dubious/hacky way to stop this without logging out or restarting my pc: When I forcefully rename `C:/Windows/System32/consent.exe` via console, e.g. to `.../consent.exe_`, Firefox will crash "properly" with an error message and I can rename it back. I have no idea what this `consent.exe` does or why it is called, which makes finding the cause or fixing the issue very hard..  Details / attempted fixe...

title: I want to disable a "choose e-mail" bar
content: So, this thing keeps appearing when i click to write an email or password, and covers up the bar, so then I can't see what I'm typing, which really bothers me because I have dyslexia and always swap letters. How do I disable this? I already tried to disable the "ask to save logins" option and it didn't solve anything. I use Linux Elementary OS.

title: do i need to fix this?
content: ok so a whole bunch of us had issues with firefox refusing to start after an update to avast cleanup premium. what worked for me was moving my mozilla file from program files to program files (x86). and actually avast fixed their problem very quickly. when i tried to move the mozilla file back to program files however, i get the following message: "your firefox profile cannot be loaded it may be missing or inaccessible"...so i'm just wondering if leaving the mozilla file in program files (x86) will cause future problems with updates or anything else. can i just leave it there or should i try to fix the profiles issue?

title: Is Flash Player available in FF 77?
content: We are using a Micro Focus enterprise application that still, for now, relies on Flash. The product will not retire Flash altogether until November 2020. Yesterday I was able to view Flash objects in this application, but today, on 77, the Flash player is disabled and I cannot figure out out to enable it. I am accustomed in Chrome to having to enable Flash for this application on each launch of Chrome...it is available in the site settings. In FF77 I cannot find a similar site-specific one-time-enable option. Is there a secret to enabling Flash for a site in FF77? Thanks!

title: Code in stead of pictures reading newspaper
content: Whilst reading my daily newspaper, when i open an article some photos are replaced by code (see example)... As i said, in some, most of the time it works fine? Seems to be the case when the newspaper uses photos imported from Twitter or an other external source? Emptying cache (and again and again...) cannot be the solution though? Thank U!

title: Remembering the oligarch password after resetting
content: Hi! I set up a oligarch password maybe two-three days before. Today as I opened my laptop and firefox, I discovered that I have totally forgot my oligarch password within these few days! I had to use the reset option, losing all the past data, as the warning said. However, just after this such a pathetic task, I remembered that I have the oligarch password! I had three years of log in and bookmark info stored in the firefox! now that i can't even log in my firefox account i am losing them all! Please please help me! Can i have my old login info back? I can provide the oligarch password if needed! It was an act of haste.

title: Firefox Mac Problems with trackpad
content: I recently installed Firefox on a Mac and migrated from Brave. Everything is fine, some things better, but I am having issues with the trackpad. In particular: 1. Jump to click in scrollbar doesn't work on most pages. Oddly, it works on pages like about:config and other Firefox internal pages. 2. I cannot make two finger page swipe between pages. Three finger swipe does but this causes issues for me in other applications. The two or three finger swipe option doesn't work. This does not happen with Brave, Chrome, and Safari.  Things I have tried: Safe mode. Reset SMC and PRAM. Uncheck and recheck boxes in the Trackpad System Preferences. New profile. MacOS 10.14.6 Firefox 77.0.1

title: CustomURL support in Firefox
content: Hi, I'm facing issue with Firefox win 10 browser for CustomURL. I have one application which is open browser for user authentication, and after authorized from browser it will ask for Open my application. This it monthly work with Google Chrome, Internet Explorer, MS Edge, Opera and other browser, but when I check with Firefox, it is not work. I face random behavior in Firefox, Case 1: 1. Case 2: 1. When Firefox browser open with URL, and it will load user authentication web page. 2. After User successful login it will popup for open application, This case is work in other browser but not work in Firefox So, Can you please help me out where I'm wrong? title: Downloading pdf files
content: I have firefox as my default browser.  However, when opening pdf documents, the default seems to be Microsof Edge.  The problem is that on some websites, when I try to switch to Firefox as the default browser for downloading pdf files, the temporary file location can't be found, resulting in the browser continuously opening tab after tab very quickly in an attempt to open the file. I have no choice but to close the entire set of tabs (there is no time to logout of anything properly as the tab multiplication is very quick. Any help would be appreciated. I have 'unhidden' the files temporarily, and it seems that the file/folder location exists, so I can't understand why it can't place them there. I am not technical, so please keep the language as simple as possible.

title: Firefox on Mac is freezing and missing min/max bar

title: Firefox doesn't show notifications
content: I have allowed notifications from Facebook and Instagram but I'm not getting any. I also tried clearing cache, cookies and even resetting everything. Nothing worked.

title: Videos slow to buffer on multiple websites
content: I've switched to Firefox (77.0.1 64 bit) from Chrome but video buffering is very slow, on YouTube, Hulu and Netflix. Other webpages load at a comparable speed to Chrome but videos do not. I've only downloaded Firefox today so I have no extensions. How can I speed up video buffering?

title: Firefox stopped playing audio from YouTube videos.
content: Firefox Version:  77.0.1 (64-bit) OS:  Ubuntu 18.04.3 I had tried to install Google Duo using Firefox but could not get the video channel from my Logitech webcam to work.  Audio from the webcam did work during a session. So I tried to set up on Chrome with the same results; audio works but not video.  So I gave up. Later I noticed that Firefox no longer played audio when viewing YouTube, however Chrome still worked properly. I tried for days to remedy, starting with confirming that autoplay audio was not blocked.  Eventually with guidance from this site I completely removed Firefox and all its hooks, files, and settings, then re-installed it.  Still will not play YouTube audio, but Chrome still works this way. P. S.  The Troubleshooting Information (optional) window below this box did not open

title: Unable to check places.sqlite integrity: Error: Error(s) encountered during stat
content: In linux Centos7 I found that all my bookmarks disapeared.  In about:support if I select verify integrity I get this- > Task: checkIntegrity - Unable to check places.sqlite integrity: Error: Error(s) encountered during statement execution: database disk image is malformed > Task: invalidateCaches - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: checkCoherence - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: expire How can it be fixed?  Thanks for any help!

title: Over ~ the last 3 weeks, all You Tube video's slow to a crawl, then stop.
content: I have been experiencing extreme slow down of Video since last week in May.  I'm on Win7 and have System restored 2x, Malwarebytes 1x, Norton full scan is done nightly and the problem has not been found while the symptoms worsen daily.  Today I tested Chrome (I prefer Firefox so I ask for assistance to resolve this) and have had no slowing, & I'm viewing the same You Tube Vids.  One other item that may be relevant.  The yellow info bar which notifies that the site loading hangup is a Website with the user option to stop it or wait.  Meanwhile the You Tube I'm watching is the only site I opened, and is not affected by the Stop it selection. Thanks in advance, Paul

title: Wordpress sites are lagging - 77.0.1
content: Greetings! Freshly installed Firefox 77.0.1 is lagging while working with WordPress based sites (I've never installed FF on this particular device (Win10 x64, ASUS + according to Everest hard-drive is completely fine) before, so there's no old settings stored) even if it's the only tab - there's a 4-5 second freeze each time. I don't use any add-ons while using FF here, but when I open the same websites via FF incognito (or Chrome) there's no problem with loading pictures, carousels and other interactive elements. What could be causing such behavior?  I have cleared cache according to Mozilla guidelines + tried other options (and haven't noticed such problem with other platforms), and it seems to me that this lag appears only at WP blogs.  Thanks in advance.

title: Screen tearing while scrolling and playing videos
content: Hello. I have some troubles with screen tearing. While scrolling pages and playing videos more than 720p(sometimes on 720p too but it almost invisible) I watching screen tearings. I checked it on other browsers (Chrome and Opera) but the problem has only Firefox. I changed false on true in about:config layers.acceleration.force-enabled but still no result. Also I turned down  graphics hardware acceleration which was recommended in that post but it doesn't help me at all. I've searched everywheare but still haven't find a solution. What should i do to fix this ?  My graphic - AMD Radeon Vega 8. All drivers are fresh and no errors were detected.

title: Sound issue with Firefox detecting hardware.
content: I started to have issues with the latest version of Firefox 77.0.1 (64bits) on my windows 10, at the time of detecting my Audio devices. Taking as an example Google Voice, It only detects the default communication for the Ringtones, Speakers and Microphone. When I click the drop down to select more hardware there is none. If I use Chrome or Edge it takes me all the devices that are on my PC. I create a screnshoot that compare firefox and chorme. Would be possible this be any type of bug or setting that I need to work with? Thanks in advance for the help. J.M
